prompts.prompt:
Task:
- Note weaknesses (e.g., unclear units, missing seasons, outliers).
- Provide ONE strong expected answer: avg FAW yield loss over last 3 seasons (% or bags/acre); note high variability if present.
- Ask 3 follow-ups: unit & baseline yield; per-season values for last 3 seasons; how it was estimated.
- Score 1–100.

Question: {{QUESTION}}
Answer: {{ANSWER}}

Task:
- Note weaknesses (e.g., vague trade-off, no units, no rationale).
- Provide a strong expected answer: willingness-to-accept yield loss to harvest 10 days earlier (% or bags/acre) with a one-clause reason (rain risk/price).
- Ask 3 follow-ups: why 10 days matters; past experience trading yield for earliness; max acceptable loss before saying no.
- Score 1–100 (integer).

Question: {{QUESTION}}
Answer: {{ANSWER}}

nodes.title: FAW Yield Loss (3 Seasons)
nodes.question: How much yield do you lose because of fall armyworm? Please think back over the last 3 seasons. (Percent or bags per acre are fine.)

nodes.title: Trade-off for 10-Day Earlier Harvest
nodes.question: If you could harvest 10 days earlier, how much yield would you be willing to give up? (Percent or bags per acre.)

nodes.title: Damage Threshold to Switch Variety
nodes.question: What level of pest or disease damage would make you stop using your current maize variety and switch to a new variety? (Give a clear threshold, e.g., % plants/ears damaged or severity.)

nodes.title: Expectations for Replacement Variety
nodes.question: What would you expect from a new maize variety to replace the one you currently grow? Please be as detailed as possible (e.g., DTM, FAW tolerance, drought stage tolerance, typical yield).

nodes.title: Minimum Acceptable Harvest in Bad Year
nodes.question: In a bad year, what is the smallest harvest you would accept and still plant this maize again next season? (Percent of usual harvest or bags per acre.)

nodes.title: Most Damaging Drought Timing
nodes.question: When in the season is drought most devastating for your crop? What is the most difficult drought moment? (e.g., pre-tassel, tasseling/silking, grain fill, pre-harvest.)
